column1: Vladimir Afanasyevich Lyakhov (Russian: ????????? ???????????? ??????; born July 20, 1941) is a former Soviet cosmonaut.
He was selected as cosmonaut on May 5, 1967, and retired on September 7, 1994.
Lyakhov was the Commander on Soyuz 32, Soyuz T-9 and Soyuz TM-6, and spent 333 days, 7 hours, 47 minutes in space.
He is married and has two children.
